COMMAND.NAME: EXPORT
COMMAND.HELP: A command to export environment variable in a form A=B

COMMAND.NAME: EXIT
COMMAND.HELP: A command to terminate execution. An optional value for this command is the return code (default value is 0)

COMMAND.NAME: INCLUDE
COMMAND.HELP:
A command to include file
>> INCLUDE filename

COMMAND.NAME: FILE
COMMAND.HELP:
A command to inline a file in the input file. The file will be extracted into WorkDir before the start of the calculation
>> FILE filename ... >> EOF

COMMAND.NAME: EOF
COMMAND.HELP: A command to close inlined file.

COMMAND.NAME: SHELL
COMMAND.HELP: A command to define a unix command to be executed in serial.

COMMAND.NAME: EXEC
COMMAND.HELP: A command to define a unix command to be executed in parallel. Note that any special characters are ignored.

COMMAND.NAME: LINK
COMMAND.HELP: A command to link two files located in WorkDir. The command is similar to '!ln -s FILE1 FILE2' but in parallel environment it is executed in all WorkDirs. The command assumes that FILE1 does exist, and FILE2 does not. >>LINK -FORCE allows to link a file FILE1 which does not exist at the moment. User should avoid the usage of LINK commands in the input.

COMMAND.NAME: COPY
COMMAND.HELP: A command to copy one file to another. The command is similar to '!cp -f /path/to/FILE1 FILE2' but can be used also in a parallel environment, in which case it will take the source file and distribute to the work directories of all processes. The destination must be located in the work directory. Note that EMIL command does not allow to use masks in the command. If FILE1 does not exist, the command returns an error code.

COMMAND.NAME: CLONE
COMMAND.HELP: A command to make a clone copy of a file, doing a local copy on all slaves if parallel. It is mostly used internally, e.g. to distribute an input file to all WorkDirs.

COMMAND.NAME: COLLECT
COMMAND.HELP: A command to copy one file to another, collecting files on slaves and put them on the master if parallel

COMMAND.NAME: SAVE
COMMAND.HELP: A command to copy one file to another, only on the master if parallel

COMMAND.NAME: RM
COMMAND.HELP: A command to delete a file. The command is similar to '!rm FILE' but can be used also in parallel environment. Note that EMIL command does not allow to use masks in the command. An attempt to remove non existent file leads to an error. It is possible to use -FORCE flag to allow deleting of non-existent file.

COMMAND.NAME: EVAL
COMMAND.HELP: A command to evaluate numerical expression, e.g. eval A=$A+1

COMMAND.NAME: DO
COMMAND.HELP: A command to start a loop. The loop should be terminated by SLAPAF or LOOP module, followed by ENDDO command

COMMAND.NAME: DOGEO
COMMAND.HELP: A command to start a constrained geometry optimization loop. The loop should be terminated by an ENDDO command

COMMAND.NAME: FOREACH
COMMAND.HELP:
A command to loop when the value of A is in the comma or space separated list.
>> foreach A in (B,C,D)
The list also can be written in the format "From .. To". Note that variable in the loop must be uppercased.

COMMAND.NAME: ENDDO
COMMAND.HELP: A command to finish the loop.

COMMAND.NAME: IF
COMMAND.HELP: A command to make conditional execution of modules/commands on iteration N

COMMAND.NAME: IFGOTO
COMMAND.HELP:
A command to make conditional execution. Allowed syntax:
* IF ( $VAR = 7 ) (IF statement terminated by ENDIF)
* IF ( $VAR = 7 ) GOTO JUMP (jump to label JUMP)
* IF ( -FILE file ) (test for existence of a file, terminated by ENDIF)

COMMAND.NAME: LABEL
COMMAND.HELP: A command to define a label. Note! Only forward jumps are allowed.

COMMAND.NAME: ENDIF
COMMAND.HELP: Terminate IF block. Note nested if's are not allowed.

KEYWORD.NAME: Project
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable can be set in order to overwrite the default name of the project you are running. The default (and recommended) value of the project name is the name of the input file (without the file extension).

KEYWORD.NAME: WorkDir
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable can be used to specify directly the directory where all files that molcas creates are placed. See MOLCAS_WORKDIR for more options.

KEYWORD.NAME: CurrDir
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable corresponds to the location of the input, and it is used as a default location for all output files, generated by molcas modules.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable indicates the location of molcas. The default version of Molcas to be used is specified at file .Molcas/molcas, located at user HOME directory.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_NPROCS
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable should be used to run molcas code in parallel. It defines the number of computational units (cores or nodes) which will be used.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_MEM
KEYWORD.HELP: This environment variable controls the size (soft limit) of the work array (in Mb) utilized in the programs that offer dynamic memory. It is also possible to set up memory in Gb, e.g. 2Gb

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_COLOR
KEYWORD.HELP: By default molcas uses markup characters in the output. To overwrite, set the key to NO

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_DEBUGGER
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable can be set to the name of debugger (or another code) which will be used on top of molcas executables. The option is useful for tracing an error in the code

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_DISK
KEYWORD.HELP: The value of this variable is used to split large files into a set of smaller datasets, as many as are needed (max. 20 subsets).

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_ECHO_INPUT
KEYWORD.HELP: An environment variable to control echoing of the input. To suppress print level, set MOLCAS_ECHO_INPUT to 'NO'.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_FIM
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate the Files in Memory I/O layer

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_INPORB_VERSION
KEYWORD.HELP: Selects the version used for writing orbital files. The value should be a version number such as 1.0 or 2.2.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_KEEP_WORKDIR
KEYWORD.HELP:
If set to NO molcas will remove scratch area after a calculation. This setting can be overwritten by running molcas with flag -clean:
molcas - clean input

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_LICENSE
KEYWORD.HELP: An environment which specifies the directory with molcas license file license.dat. The default value of this variable is directory .Molcas/ in user home directory.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_LINK
KEYWORD.HELP: An environment variable to control information about linking of files. By default (MOLCAS_LINK is not set) only essential information about linking will be printed. To increase/decrease the print level, set MOLCAS_LINK to 'Yes'/'No'.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_MAXITER
KEYWORD.HELP: An environment variable to control maximum number of iterations in DO WHILE loop

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_MAXMEM
KEYWORD.HELP: An environment variable to set up a hard limit for allocated memory (in Mb). If is not specified, then it takes value of MOLCAS_MEM. Otherwise, the (MOLCAS_MAXMEM-MOLCAS_MEM) amount of RAM will be primarily used for keeping files in memory (FiM), or allocating Distributed Global Arrays. Note that this setting is available only in MOLCAS compiled without GA.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_MOLDEN
KEYWORD.HELP: If MOLCAS_MOLDEN set to 'ON' a Molden style input file will be generated regardless of the number of orbitals.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_NEW_DEFAULTS
KEYWORD.HELP: If set to 'YES', activates new defaults (e.g. RICD, IPEA=0.0)

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_NEW_WORKDIR
KEYWORD.HELP:
If set to YES molcas will never reuse files in scratch area. This setting can be overwritten by running molcas with flag -old:
molcas - old input

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_OUTPUT
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable can alter the default directory for extra output files, such as orbitals files, molden files, etc. If set, molcas will save output files to the specified directory. The directory name can be set in the form of absolute PATH, or relative PATH (related to submit directory) A special value 'WORKDIR' will keep all output files in WorkDir. A special value 'NAME' will create a subdirectory with a name of Project. If the variable is not set, all output files will be copied or moved to the current directory. Default value can be forced by MOLCAS_OUTPUT=PWD

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_PRINT
KEYWORD.HELP: MOLCAS_PRINT variable controls the level of output. The value could be numerical or mnemonic: SILENT (0), TERSE (1), NORMAL (2), VERBOSE (3), DEBUG (4) and INSANE (5).

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_PROJECT
KEYWORD.HELP: If set to the value NAME, molcas will use the prefix of the input file as a project name, If set to the value NAMEPID, the Project name still will be constructed from the name of input file, however, the name of scratch area will be random

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_PROPERTIES
KEYWORD.HELP: If MOLCAS_PROPERTIES is set to 'LONG' properties with the individual MO contributions will be listed.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_RANDOM_SEED
KEYWORD.HELP: Set to an integer to provide a fixed seed for operations that use a random number.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_REDUCE_PRT
KEYWORD.HELP: If set to NO, print level in DO WHILE loop is not reduced

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_REDUCE_NG_PRT
KEYWORD.HELP: If set to NO, print level in numerical_gradient is not reduced.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_SAVE
KEYWORD.HELP: This variable can alter the default filenames for output files. If not set (default), all files will overwrite old files. If set to 'INCR' all output files will get an incremental filenames. If set to 'ORIG' - an existent file will be copied with an extension '.orig'

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_TIME
KEYWORD.HELP: If set, switch on timing information for each module

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_TIMELIM
KEYWORD.HELP: Set up a timelimit for each module (in seconds). By default, the maximum execution time is set to unlimited. Note that this setting is available only in MOLCAS compiled without Global Arrays.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_TRAP
KEYWORD.HELP: If set to OFF molcas modules will continue to be executed, even if a non-zero return code was produced.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_VALIDATE
KEYWORD.HELP: If set to YES, the input for each module will be validated against the documented syntax, and the calculation will stop if it does not pass. If set to CHECK, the input will be validated, but the calculation will continue, although the program itself may stop. If set to FIRST, the whole input file will be validated prior to the calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOLCAS_WORKDIR
KEYWORD.HELP: A parent directory for all scratch areas. It can be set to an absolute PATH (recommended), to a relative PATH, or to a special value PWD (to use current directory for scratch files)

MODULE.NAME: ALASKA
MODULE.HELP: This program computes the first derivatives of the one- and two-electron integrals with respect to the nuclear positions. The derivatives are not stored on files, but contracted immediately with the one- and two-electron densities to form the molecular gradients.

KEYWORD.NAME: TEST
KEYWORD.HELP: With this keyword the program will process only the input. It is a debugging aid to help you check your input.

KEYWORD.NAME: NAC
KEYWORD.HELP: Requests a calculation of the nonadiabatic coupling vector between the two specified roots in a SA-CASSCF calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOCSF
KEYWORD.HELP: In a NAC calculation, neglects the so-called CSF contribution.

KEYWORD.NAME: ONEONLY
KEYWORD.HELP: Compute only the nuclear repulsion and one-electron integrals contribution to the gradient. The default is to compute all contributions to the molecular gradient.

KEYWORD.NAME: CUTOFF
KEYWORD.HELP: Specify the threshold for ignoring contributions to the molecular gradient. The prescreening is based on the 2nd order density matrix and the radial overlap contribution to the integral derivatives.

GROUP.NAME: OFEMBED
GROUP.HELP: Orbital-Free Embedding gradient calculation, available only in combination with Cholesky or RI integral representation. The runfile of the environment subsystem renamed AUXRFIL is required.

KEYWORD.NAME: OFEM
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword OFEM requires the specification of two functionals in the form fun1/fun2 (see the manual for available functionals)

KEYWORD.NAME: DFMD
KEYWORD.HELP: In combination with OFEM, specifies the fraction of correlation potential to be added to the OFE potential (zero for KSDFT and one for HF).

KEYWORD.NAME: POLD
KEYWORD.HELP: The gradient is printed in the old format. Note: by default gradient is not printed any longer.

KEYWORD.NAME: PNEW
KEYWORD.HELP: The gradient is printed in the new human-readable format.

KEYWORD.NAME: VERBOSE
KEYWORD.HELP: The output will be a bit more verbose.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHOW
KEYWORD.HELP: The gradient contributions will be printed.

KEYWORD.NAME: NUMERICAL
KEYWORD.HELP: Forces the use of numerical gradients even if analytical ones are implemented. The default is to use analytical gradients whenever possible.

KEYWORD.NAME: ROOT
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies which root to compute the gradient the geometry for, if there is more than one root to choose from. In a RASSCF optimization, the default is to compute the gradient for the same root as is relaxed. In a MS-CASPT2 calculation, the default is to compute it for root 1.

KEYWORD.NAME: DELTA
KEYWORD.HELP: For use with numerical gradients only! The displacement for a given center is chosen as the distance to the nearest neighbor scaled by a factor. This factor can be set through the DELTa keyword. The default is 0.01.

KEYWORD.NAME: KEEP
KEYWORD.HELP: Keep the existing gradient for constrained coordinates when doing numerical differentiation.

MODULE.NAME: AVERD
MODULE.HELP: Computes average densities and corresponding natural molecular orbitals

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Title of the calculation

KEYWORD.NAME: WSET
KEYWORD.HELP: Number of input sets of orbitals and relative weight for each of them.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT
KEYWORD.HELP: Print level. Default is 1.

KEYWORD.NAME: ORBITALS
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword signifies that the densities should be created from average orbitals in the NAT*** files, not directly from the density matrices in the RUN*** files.

KEYWORD.NAME: OCCUPATION
KEYWORD.HELP: The number of average orbitals with an occupation higher than this number is reported for each symmetry. The default is 1.0d-5.

MODULE.NAME: CASPT2
MODULE.HELP: The CASPT2 program is used to compute a dynamic correlation correction to a RASSCF energy, and optionally to the density matrix and properties. It can be regarded as a Møller-Plesset perturbation method through second order (MP2), except that is is equally useful for general RASSCF root functions, also excited states, regardless of symmetry and multiplicity.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter one title line for this job.

KEYWORD.NAME: MULTISTATE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter the number of states to include in the CASPT2 calculation followed by a list of numbers indicating which CASSCF roots to use. Alternatively, enter "all" to include all roots optimized in the CASSCF calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: XMULTISTATE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter the number of states to include in the CASPT2 calculation followed by a list of numbers indicating which CASSCF roots to use. Alternatively, enter "all" to include all roots optimized in the CASSCF calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: RMULTISTATE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter the number of states to include in the CASPT2 calculation followed by a list of numbers indicating which CASSCF roots to use. Alternatively, enter "all" to include all roots optimized in the CASSCF calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: DWMS
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter a non-negative value specifying the exponent zeta used to compute the weights.

KEYWORD.NAME: DWTYPE
KEYWORD.LIST: 1: Squared energy difference,2: Square of total energy divided by Hamiltonian coupling,3: Energy difference divided by square root of Hamiltonian coupling
KEYWORD.HELP: Set to either 1, 2 or 3 to select the exponent used to obtain the weights in a XDW-CASPT2 calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: IPEA
KEYWORD.HELP: Parameter (Default 0.25), adds a shift dependent on density matrix for active orbitals, reducing overestimated correlation energy for open shells.

KEYWORD.NAME: IMAGINARY
KEYWORD.HELP: Add an imaginary shift (Default 0.0) to eliminate weak intruders.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHIFT
KEYWORD.HELP: Add a shift to the external part of the zero order Hamiltonian, which may shift away weak intruders. Imaginary shift is better.

KEYWORD.NAME: AFREEZE
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword is used to select atoms for defining the correlation orbital space for the CASPT2 calculation. Inactive orbitals with Mulliken populations smaller than a given threshold on the selected atoms will be frozen and virtual orbitals will be deleted. The next line give the number of atoms and selection thresholds. An additional line gives the names of the atoms as defined in the Seward input. Use with care! Not much tested yet, but is very effective in reducing the computational time for CASPT2 in large molecules.

KEYWORD.NAME: LOVCASPT2
KEYWORD.HELP:
"Freeze-and-Delete" type of CASPT2, available only in connection with Cholesky or RI. Needs (pseudo)canonical orbitals from RASSCF. An example of input for the keyword LOVC is the following:
LovCASPT2 0.3 DoMP2 (or DoEnv)
In this case, both occupied and virtual orbitals (localized by the program) are divided in two groups: those mainly located on the region determined (automatically) by the spatial extent of the active orbitals ("active site"), and the remaining ones, which are obviously "outside" this region. The value of the threshold (between 0 and 1) is used to perform this selection (in the example, 30% of the gross Mulliken population of a given orbital on the active site). By default, the CASPT2 calculation is performed only for the correlating orbitals associated with the active site. The keyword DoMP2 is optional and forces the program to perform also an MP2 calculation on the "frozen region". Alternatively, one can specify the keyword VirAll in order to use all virtual orbitals as correlating space for the occupied orbitals of the active site. A third possibility is to use the keyword DoEnv to compute the energy of the environment as total MP2 energy minus the MP2 energy of the active site.

KEYWORD.NAME: FNOCASPT2
KEYWORD.HELP:
Performs a Frozen Natural Orbital (FNO) CASPT2 calculation, available only in combination with Cholesky or RI integral representation. Needs (pseudo)canonical orbitals from RASSCF. An example of input for the keyword FNOC is the following:
FNOCaspt2 0.4 DoMP2
The keyword FNOC has one compulsory argument (real number in ]0,1]) specifying the fraction of virtual orbitals (in each irrep) to be retained in the FNO-CASPT2 calculation. The keyword DoMP2 is optional and used to compute the (estimated) correction for the truncation error.

KEYWORD.NAME: FOCKTYPE
KEYWORD.HELP: Present choices: G1, G2, G3. Refers to modified Fock matrices (See manual). It is better to use the default IPEA shift.

KEYWORD.NAME: FROZEN
KEYWORD.HELP: Replace default number of frozen orbitals of each symmetry type with user input. Default: Those that were frozen in the RASSCF, or standard table dependent on basis set, whichever is larger.

KEYWORD.NAME: DELETED
KEYWORD.HELP: Replace default number of deleted orbitals of each symmetry type with user input. Default: Those that were deleted in the RASSCF.

KEYWORD.NAME: DENSITY
KEYWORD.HELP: Force calculation of accurate density matrix from the CASPT2 wave function. Used for dipole moments, etc.

KEYWORD.NAME: RFPERT
KEYWORD.HELP: Add reaction field from environment as static perturbation to the one-electron Hamiltonian. The perturbation is extracted from RUNOLD if it exists, otherwise from RUNFILE.

KEYWORD.NAME: RLXROOT
KEYWORD.HELP: Which root to use in a geometry optimization of a multi-state CASPT2 wave function. Default: root defined by RLXROOT in the RASSCF module, if any, else the highest root.

KEYWORD.NAME: THRESHOLD
KEYWORD.HELP: The first threshold is for removing redundant excitations, the second is for removing linear dependences of standardized linear equation system. Default: 1.0d-10 and 1.0d-08.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAXITER
KEYWORD.HELP: The maximum allowed number of iterations. (Zero iterations gives diagonal approximation. Default:20)

KEYWORD.NAME: CONV
KEYWORD.HELP: Convergence threshold for norm of residual vector. Default 1.0d-06

KEYWORD.NAME: NOMIX
KEYWORD.HELP: Do not produce a JobMix file, even if this is a multi-state calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOMULTI
KEYWORD.HELP: Do just a series of independent CASPT2 runs, without any multi-state coupling. Useful when many roots are required, but multi-state is not needed, or desired.

KEYWORD.NAME: ONLY
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword requires the MULTistate or XMULtistate keyword, and is followed by an integer specifying one of the roots. In a Multistate calculation, it requests to compute the energy of only the specified root. However, the effective Hamiltonian coupling terms between this root and all the others included in the Multistate treatment will be computed and printed out. This output will be used in a subsequent calculation, in conjunction with the EFFE keyword.

KEYWORD.NAME: EFFE
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword requires the MULTistate or XMULtistate keyword. It is followed by the number of states and a matrix of real numbers, specifying the effective Hamiltonian couplings, as provided in a previous calculation using the ONLY keyword. In a (Extended) Multistate calculation over, e.g., 3 states, 3 separate calculations with the ONLY keyword will be performed, possibly on separate computing nodes, so as to speed up the overall process. The three couplings vectors will be given to the EFFE keyword in matrix form, i.e. the first column is made by the couplings of the first computed root, etc. The program will then quickly compute the (Extended) Multistate energies.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOORBITALS
KEYWORD.HELP: Skip printing of the MO orbitals.

KEYWORD.NAME: PROPERTIES
KEYWORD.HELP: Compute (approximate) density matrix, natural orbitals and properties.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOTRANSFORM
KEYWORD.HELP: Prevent transformation to pseudo-canonical orbitals, even if CASPT2 would assumed this is needed (Default is: transform when assumed necessary.)

KEYWORD.NAME: TRANSFORM
KEYWORD.HELP: Demand transformation to pseudo-canonical orbitals even if this was specified as option of CASSCF so it ought to be unnecessary. (Default is: transform only when assumed necessary.)

KEYWORD.NAME: OFEMBEDDING
KEYWORD.HELP: Adds an Orbital-Free Embedding potential to the Hamiltonian. Available only in combination with Cholesky or RI integral representation. No arguments required. The runfile of the environment subsystem (AUXRFIL) must be available.

KEYWORD.NAME: GHOSTDELETE
KEYWORD.HELP: Excludes from PT2 treatment orbitals localized on ghost atoms. A threshold for this selection must be specified.

KEYWORD.NAME: OUTPUT
KEYWORD.HELP: BRIEF gives a very short orbital listing, DEFAULT a normal output, and LONG a detailed listing.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRWF
KEYWORD.HELP: Threshold for printing CI coefficients. Default 0.05.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRSD
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate printing of CSFs in terms of determinants.

KEYWORD.NAME: CHEMPS2
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate DMRG-CASPT2 calculation with Molcas-CheMPS2 interface.

KEYWORD.NAME: CUMULANT
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate DMRG-cu(4)-CASPT2 calculation with Molcas-Block interface.

MODULE.NAME: CASVB
MODULE.HELP:
CASVB is a program for performing general valence bond calculations. It can be used in two basic modes:
a) variational optimization of quite general types of nonorthogonal MCSCF or modern valence bond wavefunctions, or
b) representation of CASSCF wavefunctions in modern valence form, using overlap- (relatively inexpensive) or energy-based criteria.

KEYWORD.NAME: END
KEYWORD.HELP: This marks the end of the input to the program and is the only compulsory keyword.

KEYWORD.NAME: FROZEN
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies frozen orbitals, as in the RASSCF program. This keyword is generally not required because the value stored in the job interface file or used by the RASSCF program will normally be appropriate.

KEYWORD.NAME: INACTIVE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies inactive orbitals, as in the RASSCF program. This keyword is generally not required because the value stored in the job interface file or used by the RASSCF program will normally be appropriate.

KEYWORD.NAME: NACTEL
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies number of active electrons, as in the RASSCF program. This keyword is generally not required because the value stored in the job interface file or used by the RASSCF program will normally be appropriate.

KEYWORD.NAME: RAS2
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies RAS2 orbitals, as in the RASSCF program. This keyword is generally not required because the value stored in the job interface file or used by the RASSCF program will normally be appropriate.

KEYWORD.NAME: SPIN
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the total spin, as in the RASSCF program. This keyword is generally not required because the value stored in the job interface file or used by the RASSCF program will normally be appropriate.

KEYWORD.NAME: SYMMETRY
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the CASSCF wavefunction symmetry, as in the RASSCF program. This keyword is generally not required because the value stored in the job interface file or used by the RASSCF program will normally be appropriate.

KEYWORD.NAME: CON
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies spatial VB configurations in terms of the active orbitals. The default is a single configuration of singly-occupied orbitals.

KEYWORD.NAME: COUPLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the scheme for constructing the spin eigenfunctions to be used. Possible values: KOTANI (default), SERBER, RUMER, PROJECT, LTRUMER

KEYWORD.NAME: WAVE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies number of electrons and spins to be used with a configuration list. Defaults are the values used by RASSCF.

KEYWORD.NAME: START
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies various input files. Default is to take the required information from JOBOLD.

KEYWORD.NAME: SAVE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies output files. By default, the VB CI vector is written to the file JOBIPH.

GROUP.NAME: GUESS
GROUP.HELP: Initiates guess input. Sub-keywords are ORB and STRUC, as described in the manual. The ENDGUESs keyword terminates the guess input.

KEYWORD.NAME: ORBPERM
KEYWORD.HELP: Permutes the VB orbitals, and modifies phases, as described in the manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: CRIT
KEYWORD.HELP: Defines the optimization criterion. Possible values: OVERLAP (default) or ENERGY.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAXITER
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the maximum number of iterations to be used. Default value is 50.

KEYWORD.NAME: CASPROJ
KEYWORD.HELP: Defines structure coefficients from transformed CASSCF wavefunction.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOCASPROJ
KEYWORD.HELP: Disables CASProj

KEYWORD.NAME: SADDLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Defines optimization onto an n-th order saddle point.

KEYWORD.NAME: INIT
KEYWORD.HELP: Requests a sequence of preliminary optimizations which aim to minimize the computational cost while maximizing the likelihood of stable convergence. This is the default behaviour when no wavefunction guess is available and no OPTIM keyword has been specified.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOINIT
KEYWORD.HELP: Disables INIT

KEYWORD.NAME: METHOD
KEYWORD.HELP: Selects optimization algorithm. Possible values: FLETCHER, TRIM, TRUSTOPT, DAVIDSON, STEEP, VB2CAS, AUGHESS, AUG2, CHECK, DFLETCH, NONE or SUPER. The default algorithm chosen by CASVB will usually be adequate.

KEYWORD.NAME: TUNE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enables the input of individual parameters to be used in the optimization procedure. Expert use only. See manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: OPTIM
KEYWORD.HELP: Defines one or more optimization steps. Subcommands can be any optimization declarations, as well as any symmetry or constraints specifications. Usually omitted if only one optimization step is required. Terminated by the keyword ENDOPTIm.

KEYWORD.NAME: ALTERN
KEYWORD.HELP: Defines alternating optimizations over two or more optimization steps (see manual). Terminated by the ENDALTErn keyword.

KEYWORD.NAME: SYMELM
KEYWORD.HELP: Initiates the definition of a symmetry operation (see manual). Sub-keywords are IRREPS, COEFFS, or TRANS. Terminated with ENDSYMElm.

KEYWORD.NAME: ORBREL
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the relationship between two VB orbitals under symmetry operation(s) defined by SYMElm. See manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: SYMPROJ
KEYWORD.HELP: Projects the VB wavefunction onto given irrep(s). See manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOSYMPROJ
KEYWORD.HELP: Disables SYMProj

KEYWORD.NAME: FIXORB
KEYWORD.HELP: Freezes a subset of VB orbitals (i1, i2, ...).

KEYWORD.NAME: FIXSTRUC
KEYWORD.HELP: Freezes a subset of structure coefficients (i1, i2, ...).

KEYWORD.NAME: DELSTRUC
KEYWORD.HELP: Deletes a subset of structures from the wavefunction (i1, i2, ...). Other possible values: ALL or NONE.

GROUP.NAME: ORTHCON
GROUP.HELP: Initiates input of orthogonality constraints information. Sub-keywords are ORTH, PAIRS, GROUP, STRONG and FULL, as described in the manual. The ENDORTHcon keyword terminates the ORTHcon input.

KEYWORD.NAME: CIWEIGHTS
KEYWORD.HELP: Prints weights of VB structures in the CASSCF wavefunction. Options are the same as for VBWEights.

KEYWORD.NAME: REPORT
KEYWORD.HELP: Outputs orbital/structure coefficients and derived information. Terminated by ENDREPOrt.

KEYWORD.NAME: SCORR
KEYWORD.HELP: Performs spin-correlation analysis. Only implemented for spin-coupled wavefunctions

KEYWORD.NAME: NOSCORR
KEYWORD.HELP: Disables SCORr

KEYWORD.NAME: VBWEIGHTS
KEYWORD.HELP: Prints weights of VB structures. Possible values CHIRGWIN, LOWDIN, INVERSE, ALL and NONE.

KEYWORD.NAME: PREC
KEYWORD.HELP: Adjusts the precision for printed quantities. See manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINTLEVELS
KEYWORD.HELP: Controls the amount of output. See manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHSTRUC
KEYWORD.HELP: Prints overlap and Hamiltonian matrices between VB structures.

KEYWORD.NAME: STATS
KEYWORD.HELP: Prints timing and usage statistics.

MODULE.NAME: CCSDT
MODULE.HELP: The CCSDT set of programs performs the iterative ROHF CCSD procedure, optionally followed by the (T) calculation contribution. It requires the JOBIPH file produced by RASSCF, and TRAONE and TRAINT files produced by MOTRA.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by precisely one title line, not beginning with a blank.

KEYWORD.NAME: CCSD
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies that only CCSD calculation will follow.

KEYWORD.NAME: CCT
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies that after CCSD, also the noniterative T3 calculation will follow.

KEYWORD.NAME: ADAP
KEYWORD.LIST: 0: No adaptation,1: T2 DDVV,2: T2 DDVV and T1 DV,3: Full T2 and T1,4: Full T2
KEYWORD.HELP: Choose how CCSD amplitudes should be spin adapted (if at all).

KEYWORD.NAME: DENO
KEYWORD.LIST: 0: Diagonal Fock matrix elements,1: Spin averaged diagonal,2: Orbital energies
KEYWORD.HELP: Choose the type of denominators in the CCSD procedure.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHIFT
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter level shift values for occupied and virtual orbitals.

KEYWORD.NAME: TRIPLES
KEYWORD.LIST: 0: CCSD,1: CCSD + T(CCSD),2: CCSD(T) Raghavachari,3: CCSD(T) Watts
KEYWORD.HELP: Choose the type of triples contribution calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: T3DEN
KEYWORD.HELP: Choose the type of denominators used in the (T) calculation procedure.

KEYWORD.NAME: T3SH
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter two numbers with level shifts for occupied and virtual orbitals in (T) calculations. Use with care, if at all, and consult the manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: ITER
KEYWORD.HELP: Sets the maximum number of CCSD iterations (Default:30).

KEYWORD.NAME: ACCU
KEYWORD.HELP: Change the default convergence criterion (1.0D-7) on CCSD energy.

KEYWORD.NAME: EXTR
KEYWORD.HELP: Switch on DIIS extrapolation, and set two parameters: The first iteration to employ DIIS, and the number of previous iterations to use for new prediction.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT
KEYWORD.HELP: Sets the amount of the program verbosity.

KEYWORD.NAME: LOAD
KEYWORD.HELP: Alter the file name used to save restart information (Default: RSTART)

KEYWORD.NAME: REST
KEYWORD.HELP: LINE 1: Choose restart conditions. 0=nothing saved, 1=just save restart info, 2=also start using restart info. LINE2: The restart file name (at most 6 char).

KEYWORD.NAME: IOKEY
KEYWORD.HELP: Specify the file type handling. Fortran I/O is default.

KEYWORD.NAME: MACH
KEYWORD.HELP: Use two integers to specify preferred matrix multiply type. Usually default is good, and input requires care: Consult manual!

MODULE.NAME: CHCC
MODULE.HELP: The CHCC is a Closed-Shell Coupled-Clusters Singles and Doubles program based exclusively on the Cholesky (or RI) decomposed 2-electron integrals aimed towards calculation of large system. Use of point-group symmetry is not implemented. It requires RUNFILE from the SCF module and Cholesky vectors from SEWARD.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter up to ten title lines. Do not put any keyword in the beginning of a title line.

KEYWORD.NAME: FROZ
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies number of inactive occupied orbitals in the CCSD procedure

KEYWORD.NAME: DELE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies number of inactive virtual orbitals in the CCSD procedure

KEYWORD.NAME: LARG
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the segmentation of virtual orbitals

KEYWORD.NAME: SMAL
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the auxiliary segmentation of virtual orbitals

KEYWORD.NAME: CHSE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the block size of auxiliary (Cholesky/RI) index

KEYWORD.NAME: MHKE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies if BLAS libraries (=1) or hard-code fortran is used.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOGE
KEYWORD.HELP: Pre-CCSD steps, like integrals generation, etc. are skipped.

KEYWORD.NAME: ONTH
KEYWORD.HELP: Integrals with 3- and 4-virtual indexes are generated "on-the-fly".

KEYWORD.NAME: PREC
KEYWORD.HELP: All integrals are precalculated prior to the CCSD iterations.

KEYWORD.NAME: NODI
KEYWORD.HELP: All integrals are precalculated on all computational nodes.

KEYWORD.NAME: JOIN
KEYWORD.HELP: Choose the type of parallel integral generation

KEYWORD.NAME: MAXI
KEYWORD.HELP: Maximum number of CCSD iterations.

KEYWORD.NAME: REST
KEYWORD.HELP: Restart from previous run. Currently disabled.

KEYWORD.NAME: THRE
KEYWORD.HELP: Convergence threshold for the CCSD correlation energy.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRIN
KEYWORD.HELP: Choose the print level

MODULE.NAME: CHT3
MODULE.HELP: CHT3 is a Closed-Shell Coupled-Clusters perturbative triples program based exclusively on the Cholesky (or RI) decomposed 2-electron integrals aimed towards calculation of large systems on highly parallel architectures. Use of point-group symmetry is not implemented. It requires RUNFILE from the SCF module, T1 and T2 excitation amplitudes and MO transformed Cholesky/RI vectors from CHCC.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter up to ten title lines. Do not put any keyword in the beginning of a title line.

KEYWORD.NAME: FROZ
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies number of inactive occupied orbitals in the (T) procedure

KEYWORD.NAME: DELE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies number of inactive virtual orbitals in the (T) procedure

KEYWORD.NAME: LARG
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the segmentation of virtual orbitals

KEYWORD.NAME: MHKE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies if BLAS libraries (=1) or hard-code fortran is used.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOGE
KEYWORD.HELP: Pre-(T) steps, like integrals generation, etc. are skipped.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOTR
KEYWORD.HELP: Program stops after generation of temporary integral files

KEYWORD.NAME: ALOO
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the range of triplets of virtual orbitals blocks from the fist of two parts of (T) program to be calculated.

KEYWORD.NAME: BLOO
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the range of triplets of virtual orbitals blocks from the second of two parts of (T) program to be calculated.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRIN
KEYWORD.HELP: Choose the print level

MODULE.NAME: CMOCORR
MODULE.HELP: The CMOCORR program compares the orbital spaces of two orbitals files.

KEYWORD.NAME: DOME
KEYWORD.HELP: Compare the metric of the two files. If the files correspond to different geometries the metric will be different.

KEYWORD.NAME: DOSP
KEYWORD.HELP: Compare the orbitals spaces of the two files. This keyword implies DoMetric.

KEYWORD.NAME: DOOR
KEYWORD.HELP: Compare the orbitals one by one in the two files. This keyword implies DoMetric and DoSpaces.

KEYWORD.NAME: SORT
KEYWORD.HELP: Sort the orbitals according to the type index. This might be necessary if one of the files are created by LUSCUS for example.

KEYWORD.NAME: THRE
KEYWORD.HELP: Overlap values (two numbers) below which orbitals from the two files will be reported as having small overlap. For the first number the best match in the reference file is located, for the second number no search is done.

KEYWORD.NAME: END
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword terminates the reading of the input.

MODULE.NAME: CPF
MODULE.HELP: This program performs standard SDCI calculations, or CPF calculations as described by Ahlrichs; MCPF calculations(Chong) or ACPF calculations(Gdanitz). In each case, the reference is normally a single determinant, possibly with a few high-spin coupled open shells, but low-spin cases are also possible. It was originally written by Siegbahn and Blomberg, and has only been slightly modified to fit MOLCAS. It requires a file generated by the GUGA program. See manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by a title line

KEYWORD.NAME: SDCI
KEYWORD.HELP: Single-reference SDCI calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: CPF
KEYWORD.HELP: Single-reference CPF calculation (Ahlrichs, see manual).

KEYWORD.NAME: MCPF
KEYWORD.HELP: Single-reference MCPF calculation (Chong, see manual).

KEYWORD.NAME: ACPF
KEYWORD.HELP: Single-reference ACPF calculation (Gdanitz, see manual).

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART
KEYWORD.HELP: Restart the calculation from a previous calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: THRP
KEYWORD.HELP: Set threshold on CI coefficients to be printed. Default 0.05.

KEYWORD.NAME: ECON
KEYWORD.HELP: Set energy threshold for convergence. Default 1.0D-8.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT
KEYWORD.HELP: Set print level. Default is 5.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAXITER
KEYWORD.HELP: Set maximum iterations. Default 20, max possible 75.

KEYWORD.NAME: FROZEN
KEYWORD.HELP: Specify, for each symmetry, how many orbitals to keep uncorrelated in addition to any that were frozen already by MOTRA.

KEYWORD.NAME: DELETED
KEYWORD.HELP: Specify, for each symmetry, how many orbitals to delete in addition to any that were deleted already by MOTRA.

KEYWORD.NAME: LOWSPIN
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies a low spin case, see manual.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAXPULAY
KEYWORD.HELP: Number of iterations until DIIS extrapolation is switched on.

KEYWORD.NAME: LEVSHIFT
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter level shift to use in the equation solver. Default is 0.3.

MODULE.NAME: DMRGSCF
MODULE.HELP: The DMRGSCF program generates MPS wave functions based on a given CAS model. It requires the one- and two-electron integral files generated by SEWARD, and starting orbitals from either a previous DMRGSCF/RASSCF calculation or from any of the other wave function generating programs, or from the GUESSORB facility. The resulting orbitals can be visualized, e.g. by LUSCUS.

KEYWORD.NAME: ACTIVESPACEOPTIMIZER
KEYWORD.HELP: Sets the DMRG program to be used as active space optimizer

KEYWORD.NAME: FIEDLER
KEYWORD.HELP: Enables Fiedler vector ordering.

KEYWORD.NAME: CIDEAS
KEYWORD.HELP: Enables CI-DEAS.

KEYWORD.NAME: MAX_BOND_DIMENSION
KEYWORD.HELP: Maximum bond dimension.

KEYWORD.NAME: NSWEEPS
KEYWORD.HELP: Maximum number of DMRG sweeps.

KEYWORD.NAME: DONOTDELETE
KEYWORD.HELP: Restart DMRGSCF optimization from an existing QCMaquis checkpoint.

KEYWORD.NAME: FCIDUMP
KEYWORD.HELP: Dump integrals on file FCIDUMP.

KEYWORD.NAME: SOCCUPY
KEYWORD.HELP: Set HF determinant start guess for MPS wave functions.

KEYWORD.NAME: NEVPT2PREP
KEYWORD.HELP: Prepare input for higher-order RDM/TDM evaluation.

MODULE.NAME: DYNAMIX
MODULE.HELP: The DYNAMIX program allows to do molecular dynamics simulations using the velocity Verlet algorithm. It has also the capability to detect non-adiabatic transition using a surface hopping algorithm.

KEYWORD.NAME: VELVER
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the velocity Verlet algorithm for MD simulation.

KEYWORD.NAME: DT
KEYWORD.HELP: Defines the time step of the MD simulation.

KEYWORD.NAME: VELO
KEYWORD.LIST: 0: Zero,1: Read Cartesian,2: Read mass-weighted,3: Maxwell-Boltzmann
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the initial velocities.

KEYWORD.NAME: THER
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword for temperature control.

KEYWORD.NAME: TEMP
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword to state the temperature of the simulation.

KEYWORD.NAME: HOP
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies the maximum number of transitions between electronic states.

KEYWORD.NAME: OUT
KEYWORD.APPEAR: Number of coordinates to project out
KEYWORD.HELP: Enables reduced dimensionality by projecting out the selected modes. Specify an integer N, and provide N files out.00X.xyz.

KEYWORD.NAME: IN
KEYWORD.APPEAR: Number of coordinates to keep in
KEYWORD.HELP: Enables reduced dimensionality by keeping only the selected modes. Specify an integer N, and provide N files in.00X.xyz.

KEYWORD.NAME: RESTART
KEYWORD.HELP: Restarts the trajectory at a given time, which is specified on the next line.

KEYWORD.NAME: H5RESTART
KEYWORD.APPEAR: Restart the trajectory from a H5 file
KEYWORD.HELP: Restarts a trajectory calculation from an HDF5 file, whose name is given on the next line.

MODULE.NAME: EMBQ
MODULE.HELP: This program computes the electrostatic embedding potential from known lattice cell parameters and ionic charges

KEYWORD.NAME: ELMO
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by a single integer, which specifies the largest electric multipole to be eliminated. A non-negative integer has to be supplied as argument. Default value is 0.

KEYWORD.NAME: UCVE
KEYWORD.HELP:
Specifies parameters of the crystal cell (in Angstroms). Three lines, containing three real numbers each, have to be supplied:
1st line -- components of the cell vector a1; 2nd line -- components of the cell vector a2; 3rd line -- components of the cell vector a3.

KEYWORD.NAME: UCV1
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by three real numbers. Specifies components of the lattice cell vector a1 (in Angstroms). Can be used as an alternative to keyword UCVEctors. Should be used together with keywords UCV2 and UCV3. There is no default value.

KEYWORD.NAME: UCV2
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by three real numbers. Specifies components of the lattice cell vector a2 (in Angstroms). Can be used as an alternative to keyword UCVEctors. Should be used together with keywords UCV1 and UCV3. There is no default value.

KEYWORD.NAME: UCV3
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by three real numbers. Specifies components of the lattice cell vector a3 (in Angstroms). Can be used as an alternative to keyword UCVEctors. Should be used together with keywords UCV1 and UCV2. There is no default value.

KEYWORD.NAME: UCAT
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by a single integer equal to the number of atoms in the lattice cell and a list of the corresponding coordinates and ionic charges.

KEYWORD.NAME: TETR
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by a single line containing eight integers equal to either 0 or 1. Specifies which tetrahedra are used to complement the crystal cell with EMBQ charges. Each integer corresponds to a single tetrahedron that is associated with a single corner of the crystal cell (see User's Guide for details). The tetrahedron is used if the corresponding parameter equals to 1 and not used if it equals to 0. Default: use all eight tetrahedra.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHIF
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by a single real number. Specifies the shift (in fractional coordinates) of the tetrahedra from the cell corners outwards. Default value is zero.

KEYWORD.NAME: NANO
KEYWORD.HELP:
Keyword followed by two input lines. The first line contains a single integer number (n) which specifies the shape of a nano-cluster generated using the modified cells. Possible values of n:
1 -- to generate a cubic nano-cluster;
2 -- to generate a block nano-cluster;
3 -- to generate a spherical nano-cluster.
The size of the nano-cluster is defined in the following line. The number of input parameters depends on the shape of the nano-cluster. For a cube (n=1), provide one integer k to generate a nano-cluster of (2k+1)^3 unit cells. For a block (n=2), provide six integers k1 k2 m1 m2 n1 n2 to generate a nano-cluster of
(k2-k1+1)×(m2-m1+1)×(n2-n1+1)
unit cells. For a sphere (n=3), provide one real number to generate a nano-cluster of radius R (in Angstroms). This keyword can be used instead of keywords NCCube, NCBLock, and NCSPhere. Note that only one nano-cluster will be generated. Default: the nano-cluster is not generated.

KEYWORD.NAME: NCCU
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by a single integer number k. Specifies the shape and size of the nanocluster constructed from the modified unit cells. The nanocluster is generated as a block of (2k+1)×(2k+1)×(2k+1) cells along the lattice vectors a1, a2, and a3, respectively. Default: the nanocluster is not generated.

KEYWORD.NAME: NCBL
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword followed by six integers: k1 k2 m1 m2 n1 n2 Specifies the shape and size of the nanocluster constructed from the modified unit cells. The nanocluster is generated as a block of [(k2-k1)+1]×[(m2-m1)+1]×[(n2-n1)+1] cells along the lattice vectors a1, a2, and a3, respectively. Default: the nanocluster is not generated.

KEYWORD.NAME: NCSP
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword followed by a single real number. Specifies the shape and radius (in Angstroms) of the nano-cluster constructed from the modified unit cells. Default: the nanocluster is not generated.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRIN
CALC
QMCL
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by a single integer equal to the number of atoms in the QM cluster and a list of the Cartesian corresponding coordinates (in Angstroms). Default: number of the QM cluster atoms is zero.

MODULE.NAME: ESPF
MODULE.HELP: The ElectroStatic Potential Fitted (ESPF) method adds contributions to the one-electron hamiltonian to compute the interaction between the charge distribution and any external electrostatic potential, field, and field derivatives. This module may be used for QM/MM computations. Use of symmetry is forbidden.

KEYWORD.NAME: EXTERNAL
KEYWORD.HELP: Specify how the external potential is given. Can be given inline or in another file.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: One line following this one is regarded as title.

KEYWORD.NAME: MULT
KEYWORD.HELP: Give the order of the ESPF operators. Only 0 (charge) or 1 (charge and dipole).

KEYWORD.NAME: GRID
KEYWORD.HELP: Modify the grid specifications.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHOW
KEYWORD.HELP: Printing of the ESPF.DATA file.

KEYWORD.NAME: LAMO
KEYWORD.HELP: Set on the Morokuma's scheme for scaling the link atom positions.

KEYWORD.NAME: MMIT
KEYWORD.HELP: Maximum number of microiterations to optimize the MM subsystem (with Gromacs interface).

KEYWORD.NAME: MMCO
KEYWORD.HELP: Convergence for the MM microiterations (with Gromacs interface).

MODULE.NAME: EXPBAS
MODULE.HELP: This module is used to manipulate orbital files. By default it is used to expand the orbital file to a larger basis set. This feature is available only for generally contracted basis sets (ANO or CC). The original orbital file INPORB is needed. By default, the Runfile, RUNFIL1, from the small calculation is also needed. One runs also the GATEWAY module with the larger basis set to obtain the corresponding runfile, RUNFIL2. The program will produce the file EXPORB, which can be used as the input orbital file for calculations using the larger basis set. The DESYmmetrize keyword is used to transform orbitals with symmetry to C1 symmetry. If one wants to desymmetrize the orbitals without expanding the basis set, the keyword NOEXpand must be used. When the DESY keyword is used, in combination with NOEXpand, only the INPORB file is needed. One runs the GATEWAY module with the same basis set of the original orbital file to obtain the corresponding runfile. The program will produce in output the DESORB file. In any subsequent calculation using the DESORB file, modified Cartesian coordinates are required, the ones internally generated by Molcas and printed out in the GATEWAY section of the output.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOEX
KEYWORD.HELP: Deactivates the basis set expansion.

KEYWORD.NAME: DESY
KEYWORD.HELP: Activates the basis set desymmetrization.

KEYWORD.NAME: FILE
KEYWORD.HELP: The next line specifies the filename containing the original orbitals that will be expanded to the larger basis set. By default a file named INPORB will be used.

MODULE.NAME: EXTF
MODULE.HELP: This module calculates the contribution of an external force that is acting on the system.

KEYWORD.NAME: LINEAR
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword works by specifying 4 parameters, each one in its own line after the keyword itself. First parameter (Integer) is the first atom number following the numeration of the geometry. Second parameter (Integer) is the second atom number. Third parameter is the force (Float) in nanonewton applied along the vector between the two atoms. Fourth parameter is 0 or 1 (Bool), where 0 indicates a repulsive force, and 1 is for an attractive force.

MODULE.NAME: FALCON
MODULE.HELP: FALCON calculates total energy and orbitals of the large system based on the fragment method.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: One line title.

KEYWORD.NAME: FRAGMENT
KEYWORD.HELP: Takes one, two or three argument(s). The first value defines the fragment number, the second value determines coefficient, and the third value is the fragment number that is equivalent to this fragment when translational symmetry is used. Other keyword(s) specific to this fragment must follow this keyword.

KEYWORD.NAME: OPERATOR
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the number of fragments.

KEYWORD.NAME: EQUIVALENCE
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the number of fragments.

KEYWORD.NAME: TRANSLATE
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the number of fragments.

KEYWORD.NAME: RUNFILE
KEYWORD.HELP: Following this keyword specifies the name of RunFile file for the corresponding fragment.

KEYWORD.NAME: ONEINT
KEYWORD.HELP: Following this keyword specifies the name of OneInt file for the corresponding fragment.

KEYWORD.NAME: NFRAGMENT
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the number of fragments.

KEYWORD.NAME: NIRREP
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the number of irreducible representation of point group symmetry.

KEYWORD.NAME: OCCUPATION
KEYWORD.HELP: A list of integer(s) following this keyword specifies the number of occupied orbitals in each symmetry representation.

KEYWORD.NAME: DISTANCE
KEYWORD.HELP: A real number following this keyword specifies the distance of two atoms that are equivalent to each other.

KEYWORD.NAME: NEAR
KEYWORD.HELP: A real number following this keyword specifies the distance of two atoms within which atoms are considered to be too close each other.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRINT
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the format of orbital print out.

KEYWORD.NAME: ORBENE
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the format of orbital print out.

KEYWORD.NAME: ORBOCC
KEYWORD.HELP: An integer following this keyword specifies the format of orbital print out.

MODULE.NAME: FALSE
MODULE.HELP: FALSE is an interface module that allows using external programs to compute energies and gradients for geometry optimizations with SLAPAF.

KEYWORD.NAME: RUN
KEYWORD.HELP:
Specify the external executable. It will be run as:
program input output

MODULE.NAME: FFPT
MODULE.HELP: This program applies perturbations to the one-electron Hamiltonian and the nuclear repulsion term for finite field perturbation calculations. These fields can be and external electric field or due the quadrupole moment of one or several nuclei. Additional contributions can be first order relativistic integrals (Darwin 1-el. term and mass-velocity contributions), or the so-called Well-integrals used in some forms of reaction field calculations.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Enter title line

KEYWORD.NAME: DIPO
KEYWORD.HELP: Add the external electric field. Each line contain the letters X, Y, or Z to indicate the component of the electric field followed by a real number to specify the strength.

KEYWORD.NAME: QUAD
KEYWORD.HELP: Add the external electric field gradient. Each line contains the letters XX, XY, XZ, YY, YZ, or ZZ to indicate the component of the electric field gradient followed by a real number to indicate the value.

KEYWORD.NAME: OCTU
KEYWORD.HELP: Add the external electric field Hessian. Each line contains the letters XXX, XXY, XXZ, XYY, XYZ, XZZ, YYY, YYZ, YZZ, or ZZZ to indicate the component of the electric field Hessian followed by a real number to indicate the value.

KEYWORD.NAME: EFLD
KEYWORD.HELP: Add contributions due to an nuclear dipole moment. Each line contains the letters X, Y, or Z to indicate component of the nuclear dipole moment followed by a real number to indicate the value. Finally a line is added with the syntax "ORIG x y z" is used to specify the position of the center considered.

KEYWORD.NAME: EFGR
KEYWORD.HELP: Add contributions due to an nuclear quadrupole moment. Each line contains the letters XX, XY, XZ, YY, YZ, or ZZ to indicate component of the nuclear quadrupole moment followed by a real number to indicate the value. Finally a line is added with the syntax "ORIG x y z" is used to specify the position of the center considered.

KEYWORD.NAME: RELA
KEYWORD.HELP: Specify the perturbation strength of the relativistic correction (mass-velocity and one-electron Darwin contact term).

KEYWORD.NAME: GLBL
KEYWORD.HELP: Add so-called well-integrals to the one-electron Hamiltonian. Syntax " 'Well n' 1 x " where n is specifying the index of the well-integrals as computed by Seward and x is the coefficient used when the term is added (normally the value should be 1.0).

KEYWORD.NAME: SELE
KEYWORD.HELP: Specify on which basis functions the perturbation should act.

KEYWORD.NAME: CUMU
KEYWORD.HELP: Adds the perturbation to the current H0, enabling many consecutive FFPT calls. Without this keyword, the perturbation always starts from the unperturbed H0.

MODULE.NAME: GATEWAY
MODULE.HELP: The Gateway module collects information about molecular system (geometry, basis sets, symmetry) to be used for future calculations. Note that there are two input styles - the old style format and the new XYZ format. The input can also contain an embedded reaction field input (starts with the "RF-input" keyword and terminates with the "End of RF-input" keyword). Keywords below carrying a "(RF)" are associated with that embedded RF-input section. Gateway also controls options associated with auxiliary basis sets to be used in density fitting procedures.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword followed by a title

KEYWORD.NAME: TEST
KEYWORD.HELP: GATEWAY will only process the input and generate a non-zero return code.

KEYWORD.NAME: EXPE
KEYWORD.HELP: Activates "expert mode", in which various default settings are altered. This will, for example, allow the user to combine relativistic and non-relativistic basis sets.

KEYWORD.NAME: BASDIR
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword allows to set up an extra location for basis set files. The value can be either an absolute path (started from /) or relative to submit directory, e.g. BASDIR=. In order to use a local copy of a basis set file with name FOO - place this file into directory specified in BASDIR

KEYWORD.NAME: BASLIB
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword followed by the absolute path to the basis set library directory. The default is the $MOLCAS/basis_library directory. Note that this directory must also be host to local copies of the .tbl files.

KEYWORD.NAME: ISOTOPES
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies isotopes or masses. First write the number of atom masses to change, then that number of lines, on each: the symmetry-unique index of the atom and (a) the mass number of the isotope, or (b) the mass in dalton and the word DALTON.

KEYWORD.NAME: ECPS
KEYWORD.HELP: Force GATEWAY to print ECP parameters.

KEYWORD.NAME: AUXS
KEYWORD.HELP: Force GATEWAY to print auxiliary basis set parameters.

KEYWORD.NAME: BSSH
KEYWORD.HELP: Force GATEWAY to print basis set parameters.

KEYWORD.NAME: VERB
KEYWORD.HELP: Force GATEWAY to print a bit more verbose.

KEYWORD.NAME: XBAS
KEYWORD.HELP: A keyword to specify the basis for atoms. The specification is very similar to the native format: ATOM.BasisSet. Each new atom is written at a new line. The end of the keyword is marked by an 'End of basis' line.

KEYWORD.NAME: ZMAT
KEYWORD.HELP: Alternative format to give coordinates in the form of Z-matrix. Only numerical values must be used (no variable names) and angstroms and degrees are assumed as units. Special ghost Z and dummy X atoms are allowed. 'End of ZMAT' or a blank line marks the end of the section.

KEYWORD.NAME: XYZ
KEYWORD.HELP: Alternative format to set up geometry as XYZ formatted file.

KEYWORD.NAME: COORD
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword followed on the next line by the name of an HDF5 or XYZ file, or inline coordinates in XYZ format. The keyword may appear several times. In this case all coordinate files will be concatenated, and considered as individual fragments.

KEYWORD.NAME: BASIS (XYZ)
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword followed on the next line by the name of global basis set for all atoms, or by comma separated list of basis sets for individual atoms. Note! The basis set definition in XYZ mode does not allow to use inline basis set.

KEYWORD.NAME: GROUP
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword followed on the next line by the list of group generators (with the same syntax as SYMMETRY keyword), or by FULL (highest possible group), or by NOSYM, if no symmetry operations should be used. The keyword can be used only with XYZ format of input, after COORD keyword.

KEYWORD.NAME: SYMT
KEYWORD.HELP: The keyword followed on the next line by the threshold for symmetry recognition code (default is 0.01)

KEYWORD.NAME: CSPF
KEYWORD.HELP: Turn on the use of Condon-Shortley phase factors. Warning: Causes incompatibilities.

KEYWORD.NAME: MOVE
KEYWORD.HELP: Allow to translate and rotate molecule in order to find highest possible symmetry. (this is a default for all groups, except of C1)

KEYWORD.NAME: NOMOVE
KEYWORD.HELP: Do not allow to transform coordinates while searching for highest group (default for C1 group)

KEYWORD.NAME: BSSE
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by an integer. Indicates which xyz-file that should be treated like ghost atoms.

KEYWORD.NAME: VART
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies that the energy should not be considered invariant to translations. Translational variance is detected automatically, but sometimes it may be useful to enforce it.

KEYWORD.NAME: VARR
KEYWORD.HELP: Specifies that the energy should not be considered invariant to rotations. Rotational variance is detected automatically, but sometimes it may be useful to enforce it.

KEYWORD.NAME: NUMERICAL
KEYWORD.HELP: Forces the calculation of numerical gradients even when analytic gradients are available.

KEYWORD.NAME: SHAKE
KEYWORD.HELP: Randomly modifies the initial coordinates of the atoms, maintaining the input (or computed) symmetry. This can be useful to avoid a geometry optimization converging to a higher-symmetry saddle point. The maximum displacement in the axes x, y and z is read from the following real number. This number can be followed by Bohr or Angstrom, which indicates the unit in which the displacement is specified, the default is Bohr.

KEYWORD.NAME: CONSTRAINTS
KEYWORD.HELP: This marks the start of the definition of the constraints which the optimization is subject to. This section is always ended by the keyword "End of Constraints". Consult the manual for the details.

KEYWORD.NAME: NGEXCLUDE
KEYWORD.HELP: This marks the start of the definition of additional restrictions for numerical differentiation. This section is always ended by the keyword "End of NGExclude".

GROUP.NAME: RIDFOPTIONS
GROUP.HELP: Options of RI/DF definition of auxiliary basis sets. Set various thresholds and parameters for atomic CD auxiliary basis sets.

KEYWORD.NAME: RIJ
KEYWORD.HELP: Use the RI-J auxiliary basis in the density fitting (DF) approach to treat the two-electron integrals. Note that the valence basis set must have a supporting auxiliary basis set for this to work.

KEYWORD.NAME: RIJK
KEYWORD.HELP: Use the RI-JK auxiliary basis in the density fitting (DF) approach to treat the two-electron integrals. Note that the valence basis set must have a supporting auxiliary basis set for this to work.

KEYWORD.NAME: RIC
KEYWORD.HELP: Use the RI-C auxiliary basis in the density fitting (DF) approach to treat the two-electron integrals. Note that the valence basis set must have a supporting auxiliary basis set for this to work.

KEYWORD.NAME: RICD
KEYWORD.HELP: Use the aCD or acCD approach to treat the two-electron integrals. This procedure will use an on-the-fly generated auxiliary basis set.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOCD
KEYWORD.HELP: Disable Cholesky decomposition. Useful in the case RICD has been made the default with MOLCAS_NEW_DEFAULTS.

KEYWORD.NAME: CDTH
KEYWORD.HELP: Threshold for on-the-fly generation of aCD or acCD auxiliary basis sets for RI calculations (default value 1.0d-4).

KEYWORD.NAME: SHAC
KEYWORD.HELP: Skip high angular combinations a la Turbomole when creating on-the-fly basis sets (default off).

KEYWORD.NAME: KHAC
KEYWORD.HELP: Keep high angular combinations when creating on-the-fly basis sets (default on).

KEYWORD.NAME: ACD
KEYWORD.HELP: Generate an atomic CD (aCD) auxiliary basis sets (default off).

KEYWORD.NAME: ACCD
KEYWORD.HELP: Generate an atomic compact CD (acCD) auxiliary basis sets (default on).

KEYWORD.NAME: REACTION
KEYWORD.HELP: This command is exclusive to the Kirkwood model. This indicated the beginning of the specification of the reaction field parameters. The subsequent line will contain the dielectric constant of the medium, the radius of the cavity in Bohrs (the cavity is always centered around the origin), and the angular quantum number of the highest multipole moment used in the expansion of the change distribution of the molecule (only charge is specified as 0, charge and dipole moments as 1, etc.). The input specified below specifies that a dielectric permitivity of 80.0 is used, that the cavity radius is 14.00 a.u., and that the expansion of the charge distribution is truncated after l=4, i.e. hexadecapole moments are the last moments included in the expansion. Optionally a fourth argument can be added giving the value of the dielectric constant of the fast component of the solvent (default value 1.0).

KEYWORD.NAME: PCM-MODEL
KEYWORD.HELP: If no other keywords are specified, the program will execute a standard PCM calculation with water as solvent. The solvent reaction field will be included in all the programs (SCF, RASSCF, CASPT2, etc.) invoked after SEWARD: note that in some cases additional keywords are required in the corresponding program sections. Many PCM parameters can be changed through the following keywords.

KEYWORD.NAME: SOLVENT
KEYWORD.HELP: Used to indicate which solvent is to be simulated.

KEYWORD.NAME: DIELECTRIC
KEYWORD.HELP: Defines a different dielectric constant for the selected solvent; useful to describe the system at temperatures other that 298 K, or to mimic solvent mixtures. The value is read in the line below the keyword. An optional second value might be added on the same line which defines a different value for the infinite frequency dielectric constant for the selected solvent (this is used in non-equilibrium calculations; by default it is defined for each solvent at 298 K).

KEYWORD.NAME: CONDUCTOR
KEYWORD.HELP: It requires a PCM calculation where the solvent is represented as a polarized conductor: this is an approximation to the dielectric model which works very well for polar solvents (i.e. dielectric constant greater than about 5), and it has some computational advantages being based on simpler equations. It can be useful in cases when the dielectric model shows some convergence problems.

KEYWORD.NAME: AARE
KEYWORD.HELP: It is used to define the average area (in A^2) of the small elements on the cavity surface where solvation charges are placed; when larger elements are chosen, less charges are defined, what speeds up the calculation but risks to worsen the results. The default value is 0.4 A^2 (i.e. 60 charges on a sphere of radius 2 A). The value is read in the line below the keyword.

KEYWORD.NAME: R-MIN
KEYWORD.HELP: It sets the minimum radius (in A) of the spheres that the program adds to the atomic spheres in order to smooth the cavity surface (default 0.2 A). For large solute, if the programs complains that too many sphere are being created, or if computational times become too high, it can be useful to enlarge this value (for example to 1 or 1.5 A), thus reducing the number of added spheres. The value is read in the line below the keyword.

KEYWORD.NAME: PAULING
KEYWORD.HELP: It invokes the use of Pauling's radii to build the solute cavity: in this case, hydrogens get their own sphere (radius 1.2 A).

KEYWORD.NAME: FNMC
KEYWORD.HELP: Request that the so-called Finite Nuclear Mass Correction, excluded by the Born-Oppenheimer approximation, be added to the one-electron Hamiltonian.

KEYWORD.NAME: WELL
KEYWORD.HELP: Request computation of Pauli repulsion integrals for dielectric cavity reaction field calculations.

KEYWORD.NAME: XFIELD
KEYWORD.HELP: Request the presence of an external electric field represented by a number of partial charges and dipoles. Optionally, polarisabilities may be specified whose induced dipoles are determined self-consistently during the SCF iteration.

KEYWORD.NAME: SDIPOLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Requests computation of velocity integrals.

KEYWORD.NAME: ANGM
KEYWORD.HELP: Supplement the file for transition angular momentum calculations. Enter the angular momentum operator origin (in au).

KEYWORD.NAME: OMQI
KEYWORD.HELP: Supplement the file for transition orbital magnetic quadrupole calculations. Enter the orbital magnetic quadrupole operator origin (in au).

KEYWORD.NAME: AMPR
KEYWORD.HELP: Request the computation of angular momentum product integrals and specify the angular momentum origin (in au).

KEYWORD.NAME: DSHD
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate the computation of diamagnetic shielding integrals. The first entry specifies the gauge origin. On the subsequent entries an integer specifying the number of points at which the diamagnetic shielding will be computed. If this entry is zero, the diamagnetic shielding will be computed at each nucleus. If nonzero, then the coordinates (in au) for each origin has to be supplied, one entry for each origin.

KEYWORD.NAME: MXTC
KEYWORD.HELP: Requests the computation of X2C transformed hyperfine magnetic integrals (used in subsequent hyperfine calculations), has to be used together with the keyword RX2C. If one wants to calculate the non-relativistic limit, one can simply set up a large speed of light value.

KEYWORD.NAME: RX2C
KEYWORD.HELP: Request the scalar relativistic X2C (eXact-two-Component) corrections to the one-electron Hamiltonian as well as the property integrals.

KEYWORD.NAME: RBSS
KEYWORD.HELP: Request the scalar relativistic BSS (Barysz-Sadlej-Snijders) corrections to the one-electron Hamiltonian as well as the property integrals. The non-iterative scheme is employed for the construction of BSS transformation.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOAM
KEYWORD.HELP: Explicit request for no computation of atomic mean-field integrals.

KEYWORD.NAME: AMFI
KEYWORD.HELP: Explicit request for the computation of atomic mean-field integrals (used in subsequent spin-orbit calculations). These integrals are computed by default for relativistic basis sets like the ANO-RCC and ANO-DK3 basis sets.

SELECT.NAME: EF
SELECT.APPEAR: Electric potential, field and field gradient options

KEYWORD.NAME: EPOT
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate the computation of the electric potential at some points. The first entry is the number of points at which this should be computed. The coordinates (in au) for each point have to be supplied on the subsequent entries. If the number of points is zero, the electric potential on each nucleus will be computed.

KEYWORD.NAME: EFLD
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate the computation of the electric potential and field at some points. The first entry is the number of points at which this should be computed. The coordinates (in au) for each point have to be supplied on the subsequent entries. If the number of points is zero, the electric field on each nucleus will be computed.

KEYWORD.NAME: FLDG
KEYWORD.HELP: Activate the computation of the electric potential, field and field gradient at some points. The first entry is the number of points at which this should be computed. The coordinates (in au) for each point have to be supplied on the subsequent entries. If the number of points is zero, the electric field gradient on each nucleus will be computed.

KEYWORD.NAME: EMPC
KEYWORD.HELP: Use point charges specified by the keyword XFIELD when calculating the Orbital-Free Embedding potential.

KEYWORD.NAME: FINITE
KEYWORD.HELP: Request a finite center representation of the nuclei by a single exponent s-type Gaussian.

KEYWORD.NAME: MGAUSSIAN
KEYWORD.HELP: Request a finite center representation of the nuclei by a modified Gaussian.

KEYWORD.NAME: RP-COORD
KEYWORD.HELP: This activates the Saddle method for TS geometry optimization. The line is followed by an integer specifying the number of symmetry unique coordinates to be specified. This is followed by two sets of input - one line with the energy and then the Cartesian coordinates in bohr - for each of the two starting structures of the Saddle method. Note that the order of the coordinates must always match the order specified with the conventional input of the coordinates of the molecular system. Alternatively, two lines with the filenames containing the coordinates of reactants and products, respectively, (in XYZ format) can be given.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOALIGN
KEYWORD.HELP: By default, the two starting structures are aligned to minimize the root mean square distance (RMSD) between them, in particular, the first structure is moved and the second structure remains fixed. If this keyword is given, the starting structures are used as given.

KEYWORD.NAME: ALIGNONLY
KEYWORD.HELP: The two starting structures are aligned, but nothing more is done. An input block for SEWARD is still needed, but no integrals are computed.

KEYWORD.NAME: WEIGHTS
KEYWORD.HELP:
Relative weights of each atom to use for the alignment and for the calculation of the "distance" between structures. The possibilities are:
MASS -- This is the default. Each atom is given a weight proportional to its mass. Equivalent to mass-weighted coordinates.
EQUAL -- All atoms have an equal weight.
HEAVY -- Only heavy atoms are considered, with equal weights. Hydrogens are given zero weight.
A list of N numbers can also be provided, and they will be used as weights for the N symmetry-unique atoms.

KEYWORD.NAME: SADDLE
KEYWORD.HELP: Step size reduction for each macro iteration of the saddle method. The value is given in weighted coordinates, divided by the square root of the total weight (see the WEIGHTS keyword). Default value is 0.1 au.

KEYWORD.NAME: HYPER
KEYWORD.HELP: Perform a geometry optimization in constrained internal coordinates using user-defined parameters for hypersurface gridpoints.

KEYWORD.NAME: GEO
KEYWORD.HELP: Perform a geometry optimization in constrained internal coordinates using default parameters for hypersurface gridpoints (bond=0.15, bond angle=2.5, and dihedral angle=2.5)

KEYWORD.NAME: OPTH
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by one line with an integer specifying the optimization type (1 = steepest descent, 2 = mixed, 3 = Newton's method), a second line with a real number specifying a step factor and if using type "mixed" a third line with a real number specifying the maximum gradient size for which steepest descent is used.

KEYWORD.NAME: OLDZ
KEYWORD.HELP: Start new calculation based on $Project.GEO/$Project.zmt

KEYWORD.NAME: ZONLY
KEYWORD.HELP: Prints a z-matrix ($Project.zmt) in the directory $Project.GEO.

KEYWORD.NAME: ZCONS
KEYWORD.HELP: Prints a constraints-file ($Project.cns) and an xyz-file (cons.xyz) with matching atom numbering in the directory $Project.GEO .

KEYWORD.NAME: ORIG
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by two lines for each fragment. The first line should have 3 real numbers defining a translation and the second 9 real numbers defining a rotation.

KEYWORD.NAME: FRGM
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by a fragment number and either or both of ROT and TRANS to define rotation and translation of this fragment.

KEYWORD.NAME: ROT
KEYWORD.HELP: The nine numbers define a rotation matrix.

KEYWORD.NAME: TRANS
KEYWORD.HELP: The three numbers define a translation. (x y z)

MODULE.NAME: GENANO
MODULE.HELP: This program is used to construct ANO type basis sets.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword starts the reading of title lines, with no limit on the number of title lines. Reading the input as title lines is stopped as soon an the input parser detects one of the other keywords.

KEYWORD.NAME: SETS
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword indicates that the next line of input contains the number of sets to be used in the averaging procedure.

KEYWORD.NAME: CENTER
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword is followed, on the next line, by the atom label for which the basis set is to be generated. The label must match the label you supplied to SEWARD.

KEYWORD.NAME: ROWWISE
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword makes GENANO to produce the contraction coefficients row-wise instead of column-wise as is the default.

KEYWORD.NAME: PROJECT
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword states that you want to project out certain degrees of freedom from the density matrix. This can be useful for generating, for example, nodeless valence orbitals to be used with ECP's. If this keyword is specified, you must supply the file PROJ obtained as file ANO from a previous GENANO calculation, for instance.

KEYWORD.NAME: LIFTDEGENERACY
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword will modify the occupation numbers read from the orbitals files. The purpose is to lift the degeneracy of core orbitals to avoid rotations. The occupation numbers are changed according to o'=o*(1+10^-3/n) where n is the sequence number of the orbital in its irreducible representation.

KEYWORD.NAME: RYDBERG
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword enables automatic generation of Rydberg orbitals. With this keyword all occupied orbitals will get occupation number zero while the virtual orbitals will get a small occupation number decreasing with orbital number. Useful with a calculation on an cation where the virtual orbitals are near perfect Rydberg orbitals. Note that you must use orbitals from the SCF or RASSCF program.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOTHRESHOLD
KEYWORD.HELP: This keyword is used to specify the threshold for keeping NO's (natural orbitals). Orbitals with occupation numbers less than the threshold are discarded. The threshold is read from the line following the keyword.

MODULE.NAME: GEO
MODULE.HELP: The GEO module handles geometry optimization in constrained internal coordinates.

MODULE.NAME: GRID_IT
MODULE.HELP: GRID_IT is an interface program for calculations of molecular orbitals and density in a set of Cartesian grid points. Calculated grid can be visualized by LUSCUS programs

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: One line following this one is regarded as title.

KEYWORD.NAME: NAME
KEYWORD.HELP: One line following this one is used for generation of grid filename in the form: "Project.Name.lus".

KEYWORD.NAME: FILE
KEYWORD.HELP: On the following line user can specify the filename, which will be used instead of INPORB (default).

KEYWORD.NAME: SPARSE
KEYWORD.HELP: Set up sparse Cartesian net with 1 grid point per a.u. Note that quality of the grid can be poor. Default is 3 points per a.u.

KEYWORD.NAME: DENSE
KEYWORD.HELP: Set up dense Cartesian net with 10 grid point per a.u.

KEYWORD.NAME: GAP
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by real equals to distance between the atomic nuclei in the molecule and the border of grid. Default value is 4.0 a.u.

KEYWORD.NAME: ORBITAL
KEYWORD.HELP: Direct specification of orbitals to show. Follows by number of calculated grids, and pairs of integers -- symmetry and orbital within this symmetry.

KEYWORD.NAME: SELECT
KEYWORD.HELP: Direct specification of orbitals to show. Follows by one line in the format: symmetry:FirstOrbital-LastOrbital (Ex: 1:2-7 2:5-8)

KEYWORD.NAME: MULLIKEN
KEYWORD.HELP: Compute Mulliken charges separately for each occupied MO specified in the GRID_IT input. "LONG print" is an optional argument for more detailed printout.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOSORT
KEYWORD.HELP: Do not sort orbitals by occupation numbers and orbital energies

KEYWORD.NAME: ORANGE
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by 2 numbers to limit the interval of orbitals by occupation numbers

KEYWORD.NAME: ERANGE
KEYWORD.HELP: Followed by 2 numbers to limit the interval of orbitals by one-electron energies

KEYWORD.NAME: ALL
KEYWORD.HELP: Calculate grids for all molecular orbitals.

KEYWORD.NAME: TOTAL
KEYWORD.HELP: Request to calculate a grid for the (correct) total density computed from contributions of all orbitals, instead of (default) just from the orbitals chosen by user.

KEYWORD.NAME: VB
KEYWORD.HELP: Plots orbitals from the latest CASVB calculation.

KEYWORD.NAME: ATOM
KEYWORD.HELP: Calculate density in the position of atoms

KEYWORD.NAME: ASCII
KEYWORD.HELP: Obsolete keyword for ASCII format of output file. This option can only be used in combination with NOLUSCUS

KEYWORD.NAME: NPOINTS
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword, followed by 3 integers equal to number of grid points in x, y, z directions

KEYWORD.NAME: GRID
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword to set manually coordinates of a grid. Followed by number of Cartesian coordinates, and on next lines -- x y z coordinates of a grid (in a.u.)

KEYWORD.NAME: GORI
KEYWORD.HELP: Keyword to set manually the parallelepiped spanning a grid. Followed by four lines of three columns each. The first line defines the x y z location of the origin, the next three lines are three linearly independent vectors that span the parallelepiped of the grid. This keyword requires NPOINTS to build up the lattice of gridpoints.

KEYWORD.NAME: NOLUSCUS
KEYWORD.HELP: Produce data file in obsolete format (which can be read by old (before 2015) versions of GV)

KEYWORD.NAME: XFIELD
KEYWORD.HELP: Use Grid_It in a special mode (to produce the grid for non-cartesian points).

MODULE.NAME: GUESSORB
MODULE.HELP: The GUESSORB program generates a start guess for orbitals. These orbitals can be used as input for all wavefunction code.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRMO
KEYWORD.HELP:
Print the generated orbitals, an integer controls the output level. Optionally, a floating point number limits the orbitals printed to those with energy below the number (default 5.0 au).
1 -- Only occupation numbers and orbital energies are printed.
2 -- As for 1 but with an additional sorted list of orbital energies.
3 -- As for 2 but with orbitals printed in compact format.
4 -- As for 3 but orbitals are printed in full format.

KEYWORD.NAME: PRPO
KEYWORD.HELP: Prints Mulliken population analysis.

KEYWORD.NAME: STHR
KEYWORD.HELP: Threshold for deleting orbitals based on overlap. Default 1e-9.

KEYWORD.NAME: TTHR
KEYWORD.HELP: Threshold for deleting orbitals based on kinetic energy. Default 1e6.

KEYWORD.NAME: GAPT
KEYWORD.HELP: Threshold for populating orbitals. Default 0.01.

MODULE.NAME: GUGA
MODULE.HELP: The GUGA program generates coupling coefficients used by the MRCI and the CPF programs. The program was written by P. E. M. Siegbahn, and has since been slightly modified to fit MOLCAS.

KEYWORD.NAME: TITLE
KEYWORD.HELP: The line following this keyword is treated as title line

KEYWORD.NAME: SPIN
KEYWORD.HELP: Spin degeneracy number (multiplicity), 2S+1. Default 1=Singlet.

KEYWORD.NAME: ELECTRONS
KEYWORD.HELP: Number of electrons to be correlated.

KEYWORD.NAME: NACTEL
